meanings.definition: To cut off small bits or pare away material from a piece of wood.
meanings.sent1: He was widdling a small figurine out of a block of wood.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter enjoys widdling intricate designs on his furniture.
meanings.sent3: While widdling away at the wood, he accidentally made a tiny boat.
meanings.sent4: She widdled away at the log until it transformed into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The sound of widdling wood echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: To spend time aimlessly or idly.
meanings.sent1: Instead of working, he spent the afternoon widdling on his phone.
meanings.sent2: Children often widdle away their time playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: She found herself widdling through the pages of an old book.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to widdle away when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The cat widdled around the house, exploring every corner.

meanings.sent1: The puppy widdled on the grass outside.
meanings.sent2: After holding it in for so long, he finally widdled in relief.
meanings.sent3: The tree looked like it was widdling raindrops during the storm.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she could widdle a river after drinking so much water.
meanings.sent5: The sound of widdling water filled the quiet night.
